article.headline: Holy Cross 64, Brown 41
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Tim Clifford scored 21 points on 9-for-12 shooting as Holy Cross took control early in a 64-41 win over Brown on Wednesday night. Keith Simmons added 14 points for Holy Cross (4-4), which limited Brown to 29 percent shooting in the game and forced 19 turnovers. Sam Manhanga scored 18 to lead the Bears (1-5), who lost their third in a row. Manhanga scored two field goals as the Bears took an early 9-5 lead, but Torey Thomas found Simmons for an alley-oop dunk that sparked a 14-2 run for Holy Cross over the next 7:42. Clifford had four straight field goals during the run, the last one a dunk after a behind-the-back pass from Colin Cunningham. Manhanga scored eight points as Brown pulled within 26-21 with 4:57 left in the first half, but Holy Cross finished the half with an 11-1 run for a 37-22 halftime lead. Brown pulled within 11 early in the second half, but Kevin Hamilton hit a 3-pointer to ignite a run that gave the Crusaders a 52-32 lead with less than 10 minutes to play.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
